meanings.definition: The speed at which a person walks; a pace.
meanings.sent1: She matched his footpace as they strolled through the park.
meanings.sent2: The footpace of the elderly man was slow but steady.
meanings.sent3: Trying to keep up with her friend's footpace, Sarah ended up jogging.
meanings.sent4: The footpace of the marathon runner was like a rhythmic drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The footpace of the toddler was adorable as he waddled along.

meanings.definition: A platform or step on which to stand or walk.
meanings.sent1: The footpace of the ladder made it easy to reach the top shelf.
meanings.sent2: The footpace of the stage was wide enough for the actors to move freely.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a cozy spot on the footpace of the window sill.
meanings.sent4: The footpace of the bridge offered a stunning view of the river below.
meanings.sent5: The footpace of the porch was a perfect place to enjoy the sunset.
